docs.text: Command line ¶ This guide introduces working with taxonomy data from your command line Install gitsheets ¶ The git sheet command can be installed to your system via NPM: npm install -g gitsheets Reading to a spreadsheet ¶ git sheet query issues --format = csv > /tmp/issues.csv Reading to a JSON file ¶ git sheet query issues > /tmp/issues.json Formatting with jq ¶ git sheet query issues | jq Extract a list of IDs ¶ git sheet query issues | jq -r '.[].id' Get display name for a given ID ¶ tag = "covid-19" display_name = $( git sheet query issues --filter.id = " ${ tag } " | jq -r '.[].display_name' ) echo " ${ tag } => ${ display_name } "
docs.title: Command line

docs.text: This guide introduces working with taxonomy data from your command line

docs.text: The git sheet command can be installed to your system via NPM: npm install -g gitsheets

docs.text: tag = "covid-19" display_name = $( git sheet query issues --filter.id = " ${ tag } " | jq -r '.[].display_name' ) echo " ${ tag } => ${ display_name } "
docs.title: Get display name for a given ID
